name: unbolted
content:
unbolted adjective
(DOOR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not closed with a bolt (= a metal bar on a door or window that slides across to lock it): Someone had left the gate to the yard unbolted and thieves got in during the night and stole a large amount of copper piping. The unbolted door had worked open and was banging in the wind.
More examplesFewer examplesAn unbolted door is an open invitation to the casual thief.Make sure that none of the windows are unbolted before leaving. She pushed open the unbolted door and walked into the entrance hall.

unbolted adjective
(FLOUR)
(of flour) that has not been put through a sieve (= a wire net shaped like a bowl) to break up or remove large pieces: Wholewheat flour is an example of unbolted flour. This old recipe uses 500 g of unbolted flour.
More examplesFewer examplesThey produce both fine bolted flour and the coarse unbolted variety.Wholewheat bread is made from flour that is unbolted.The recipe calls for three tablespoonfuls of unbolted wheat.
